name: Olfrid Battle-Born
stunts: Merchant Prince: +2 to Resources when conducting trade or business negotiations
Well Connected: +2 to Contacts in Whiterun and surrounding holds
Family Reputation: Once per session, invoke Battle-Born name for advantage in social situations
notes: Olfrid Battle-Born is the patriarch of one of Whiterun's oldest and most influential families. Wealthy and well-connected, he maintains business relationships throughout Skyrim, including with the Thieves Guild. While publicly neutral, he secretly supports the Imperial Legion. His family's ancient feud with the Gray-Manes has intensified with the civil war, as the Gray-Manes openly support the Stormcloaks.
combat_tactics: Olfrid is not a warrior and will avoid combat at all costs. He relies on hired guards and his social influence to resolve conflicts. If cornered, he'll attempt to talk his way out or flee to safety.

starting_equipment.armor: Fine Nordic Clothing (Armor:0, +1 to Rapport in social settings)

social_interaction: Olfrid is proud, dignified, and somewhat pompous. He speaks with authority and expects respect due to his family name. He's shrewd in business but his family pride can cloud his judgment. While he maintains public neutrality, his Imperial sympathies slip through in private conversations. He's dismissive of the Gray-Manes and quick to defend Battle-Born honor.

relationships.Jon Battle-Born: Son, worries about his friendship with Gray-Mane girl
relationships.Gray-Mane Family: Ancient rivals, intensified by civil war
relationships.Brynjolf: Secret business contact through Thieves Guild

personality_notes.speaking_style: Formal and dignified, often mentions family legacy, condescending to those of lower status
quirks: Judges people by lineage and wealth
personality_notes.character_growth: May learn humility through war's consequences, could reconcile with Gray-Manes, or become more bitter

thieves_guild_connection.role: Secret patron and fence for guild operations in Whiterun hold
thieves_guild_connection.services: Provides market intelligence, storage for goods, political cover
thieves_guild_connection.motivation: Profits from guild arrangements and gains intelligence network
thieves_guild_connection.vulnerability: If exposed, could damage both family reputation and Imperial connections

battle_of_whiterun_role.before_battle: Receives intelligence from both sides, prepares family assets
battle_of_whiterun_role.during_battle: Secretly aids Imperial forces while maintaining public neutrality
battle_of_whiterun_role.after_battle: Seeks to profit from reconstruction, may openly declare for winner
battle_of_whiterun_role.player_interaction: If PC delivers Brynjolf's message during battle preparations, Olfrid may provide intelligence or request PC's help protecting family interests

story_hooks: Contact point for Thieves Guild operations in Whiterun
Source of political intelligence about Whiterun and civil war
Can provide introduction to Imperial sympathizers
Family feud creates dramatic tension and side quests
May request PC help protecting business interests during battle

dialogue_samples.greeting: The Battle-Born name has stood for honor and prosperity for generations. What brings you to our door?
dialogue_samples.thieves_guild_contact: Ah, Brynjolf's associate. Good. We must be discreet - these are delicate times. My family's reputation must remain... unblemished.
dialogue_samples.civil_war_discussion: Publicly, I remain neutral as Jarl Balgruuf does. But between us... the Empire represents order and civilization. Ulfric's rabble would tear Skyrim apart.
dialogue_samples.gray-mane_mention: The Gray-Manes? Stormcloak sympathizers and traitors, the lot of them. Their 'honor' is nothing but stubborn pride.
dialogue_samples.during_battle: My family has endured for centuries. We will survive this war, no matter which side claims victory. Though I have... preferences.

neutral_faction_integration.thieves_guild_start: When Brynjolf sends the PC to Whiterun, they find Olfrid anxious about the approaching battle. He needs the guild's help securing valuable goods before fighting begins.
neutral_faction_integration.meeting_location: Battle-Born house or discreet meeting at market
neutral_faction_integration.leads_to_encounter: While meeting with Olfrid, the Battle of Whiterun erupts, forcing PC to choose between Hadvar (Imperial) and Ralof (Stormcloak)
